title: Don’t look now, but ex-Mets catcher leads AL in home runs
body: Detroit Tigers' Wilson Ramos swings on a home run during the ninth inning of the team's baseball game against the Houston Astros on Tuesday, April 13, 2021, in Houston. The 33-year-old backstop played for the Mets in 2019 and 2020, hitting a combined .276 in 186 games with 19 home runs.No, I’m not seriously suggesting the Mets should’ve kept Ramos over McCann. But it’s hard to ignore Ramos’ hot start to the season. His power production also shouldn’t come as a surprise to anyone. In eight of his 12 MLB seasons, Ramos has hit at least 10 home runs, including a career-best 22 in 2016 with the , earning his first All-Star nod.
